note: Sustainability index (NSI) ranges from 0–100 with 50 as neutral.
methodology_note: Bullish and bearish scores were assigned based on qualitative assessment of recent news and research across each cluster. Weighted averages are computed using specified weights for each cluster (AI_CAPEX 0.25, POWER_GRID 0.20, UNIT_ECONOMICS 0.20, SEMI_SUPPLY 0.15, ENTERPRISE_DEMAND 0.15, POLICY_GEOPOLITICS 0.05). The sustainability index (NSI) equals 50 + 0.5 * (Overall Bullish − Overall Bearish), bounded between 0 and 100.

clusters.name: Power Grid & Energy
rationale: AI could drive data-center power demand from 4 GW to 123 GW by 2035 and consumption may more than double by 2030
Data centers already consume 26% of Virginia’s electricity and up to 80% in Dublin; grid connections can take years
clusters.latest_title: Power Constraints Threaten AI Data-Center Growth

clusters.name: Semiconductor Supply
rationale: Generative‑AI chip revenues are projected to exceed $150 B in 2025
Advanced chips represent <0.2% of wafer capacity and Europe aims to double its small share; export controls and uncertain subsidies add risk
clusters.latest_title: AI Chip Demand Strains Semiconductor Supply Amid Policy Risks

clusters.name: Policy & Geopolitics
rationale: The EU AI Act creates a risk-based framework and the EU Chips Act aims to raise Europe’s semiconductor share to 20%
Export controls restrict chip sales to countries of concern and the U.S. Chips Act may be repealed, increasing uncertainty
clusters.latest_title: Regulation and Geopolitics Reshape AI Landscape

clusters.name: AI Capex and Capacity
rationale: Hyperscalers spent ~$210 B on AI data-center capex in 2024
Analysts forecast $5–7 T in cumulative AI capex by 2030 and AI may account for 70% of demand
clusters.latest_title: Hyperscalers Expand AI Capex Amid $7 Trillion Buildout

clusters.name: Enterprise Demand
rationale: U.S. private AI investment reached $109 B in 2024 and 78% of organisations report using AI
Only a minority have redesigned workflows and moved use-cases into full production
clusters.latest_title: Enterprise AI Adoption Grows But Monetization Lags

clusters.name: Unit Economics & Efficiency
rationale: Per-token inference costs have fallen by more than two orders of magnitude since 2021
AI servers operate at 80–90% utilisation but gross margins remain around 50–60%, indicating thin profitability
clusters.latest_title: AI Unit Costs Plunge While Margins Remain Thin

ccr.label: Capital Coverage Ratio (CCR)
ccr.note: Estimated using OpenAI revenue versus depreciation+interest and opex for installed AI capacity

psr.label: Power Security Ratio (PSR)
psr.note: Ratio of secured power (PPAs and interconnect approvals) to needed AI power derived from utility commitments versus projected 123 GW demand
